Nursing is normally seen as a vocation, with much of the reward coming from looking after people, and contributing to the society, but nursing is still a job, and you will get a nurse salary as part of your occupation. The Bureau of Labour Statistics keeps information on how much money each and every nurse gets in their wages, and could help to reveal that, while most people are yet finding it extremely difficult to earn a good wage in formerly vital jobs such as accountant or financial advisor, the average nursing salary has improved year on year.
The salary that the regular Licensed Practical Nurse receives in the United States is US$35000. This figure though can be somewhat inconclusive. Upon examining the facts in detail it gets quickly apparent that the span of licensed practical nurses wage varies rather largely due to the location of the job. In Puerto Rico, as a Licensed Practical Nurse you can get a little in excess of $16,000, in contrast in a quantity of east coast cities you might reasonably expect an LPN pay more than $45000 each year. Note this would not be only for the highest paid Licensed Practical Nurse employment but the average earnings.
Cost of living is measured by the ACCRA Cost of Living Index which accounts for housing, utilities, transportation, groceries, health care, and miscellaneous consumer products. An ACCRA value above 100 represents a cost of living higher than the national average while a value below 100 indicates a cost of living lower than the national average. The highest ACCRA values are Hawaii (163), Alaska (133.93), California (131.46), Connecticut (128.8) and New York (128.02). The lowest ACCRA values are Tennessee (89.05), Kentucky (89.18), Oklahoma (89.48), Arkansas (90.18) and Texas (91.26).
Many great RN jobs exist around the nation, but many experts agree the best cities to be a nurse are San Francisco, New York and Boston. Although the cost of living is much higher in these cities and their surrounding metropolitan areas compared to some other areas, the higher wages and wide range of available jobs in nursing more than make up for it. Here are some details about these cities and why nurses flock to them.
The state in which LPNs by and large collect the best salary is Massachusetts. It is the highest paid LPN state in US with a median LPN wage of USD 48,180 per annum, closely followed by District of Columbia with average annual wages of US$45,450. Third in line is Rhode Island where average salary for an LPN is US$43460, with fourth place going to Delaware at USD 41,460 each year. Next is New Jersey with the average Licensed Practical Nurse wage here being USD 41,240 with average LPN income for Maryland also coming in greater than the $40,000 barrier. The origin of all these salaries is a report by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics.
